results.title: Early American civilizations (Mayan, Aztec, Incan)
results.brief_description: A description of three important civilisations that flourished before the Spanish conquest in the new world - Mayan, Aztec and Incan. This film stresses the economic background shared by all three cultures, an economy based on corn. Shows Mayan carvings, the Teotihuacano’s Pyramid of the Sun, the Aztec calendar stone, Incan weavings and other art objects and ruins.

results.title: Early Amateur Sound Film (1936–37)
results.brief_description: Amateur filmmaker Archie Stewart used an RCA Sound Camera to document family life from 1935. A member of the Amateur Cinema League, in 1937 he published one of the first articles on amateur sound, ‘A Talkie Movie Maker Speaks’, in the league’s magazine.

constellations_other.name: Amateur hour
constellations_other.description: Early sound equipment allowed filmmakers and amateurs alike the ability to experiment often with affordable 16mm film.

results.title: Early actualities [Silent]
results.brief_description: This is a compilation of early short silent films made between 1900-1905 about newsworthy events. Each “short” is preceded by explanatory titles as follows: THE BOER WAR: DEPARTURE OF THE GORDON HIGHLANDERS (OCT. 1899); LORD ROBERTS ARRIVES IN CAPE TOWN (JAN.1900); STREET SCENE IN LEEDS (C.1903); SCENE ON BRIGHTON PIER (C.1898); FIRE BRIGADE SCENE IN BRITAIN, FRANCE AND U.S.A. (C.1896-1902); FUNERAL OF QUEEN VICTORIA (FEB.1901).

results.title: Early abortion
results.brief_description: Uses scenes from a question-and-answer session and from an abortion procedure in order to explain a typical atravmatic abortion procedure. Narrated by Adrienne Barbeau and animation by Robert Greenberg

results.title: Eagles on the ranges (Aquila audax)
results.creator_credit: Australian Wildlife Video & Documentaries and Frank Paul Muscolino
results.brief_description: A sequel to “Where eagles nest” this is a study of twin young eagles which form part of a group of seven eagles born over three breeding seasons. Beginning with the twin chicks in their nest under the protective eye of their mother, we follow a progressive journey of the chicks as they become young eagles fending for themselves and taking their first hesitant attempts at flight. Filmed on the north-east side of the Great Dividing Range in the “Valley of a Thousand Hills”, on the watershed of the Yea River, the King Parrot Creek and the Strath Creek through to the foot of Mount Tallarook and Upper Goulburn River in Victoria, Australia, Frank Muscolino’s cinematography provides close-up and in some cases, extremely rare and hard to get footage, of these magnificent birds in flight, swooping and soaring as they hunt for food. Also includes footage of such native animals as kangaroos, koalas and cockatoos. With minimal commentary, background music and the sounds of nature, this is an interesting film, particularly for bird lovers. Narrator: Rod Cook.

results.title: Eager to write: Lorraine Wilson
results.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions and Andrew Scollo
results.brief_description: Dicusses the ways in which children learn to write and how children who find writing difficult can be encouraged and taught. Features many of the ideas of Lorraine Wilson.

results.title: Eadweard Muybridge: zoopraxographer
results.creator_credit: University of California, Los Angeles and Thom Andersen
results.brief_description: Documents the pioneering photographic work of Eadweard Muybridge (1830-1904) in which he rigorously analysed human and animal motion. Muybridge’s multiple camera techniques and his projection device, the zoopraxiscope, were technical curiosities unnecessary for the development of the modern motion picture but through them he overcame a philosophical obstacle. He demonstrated empirically that the infinite flux of time could be reconstructed from a finite number of photographs.
